e4: Switching to the new policy ensures accurate, transparent reporting of financial performance, aligning with ethical standards and reducing risks of legal issues or investigations. Although initial investor confusion may occur, clear communication of the change should mitigate misunderstandings over time, fostering trust and long-term credibility with investors.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should ensure accuracy, transparency, and honesty in financial statements, reflecting true performance without manipulations. It should consider fairness to all investors, minimizing information asymmetry that benefits only a few. Compliance with legal standards and proactive communication to accurately inform investor expectations are crucial for maintaining trust and integrity.
e6: What steps will be taken to communicate the policy change to all investors clearly? How does management plan to handle potential initial market reactions or misunderstandings? Are there any strategies in place to monitor the impact on stock performance and investor relations?
